tldr: Q3 2025 organic sales accelerated to 6% with adjusted EPS of $2.82, and orders jumped 22% to $11.9B with a book-to-bill above 1. Management raised full-year guidance again despite the Solstice spin impact, projecting sales of $40.7B-$40.9B and EPS of $10.6-$10.7, with Q4 sales of $10.1B-$10.3B and EPS of $2.52-$2.62.
bullets: Organic sales rose 6% and adjusted EPS increased 9% to $2.82; orders grew 22% to $11.9B and backlog hit another record.
Aerospace grew 12% organically (margin 26.1%); industrial automation returned to growth (+1%); building automation grew 7% with margin expansion; ESS declined 2% on licensing and catalyst timing.
Guidance raised: FY organic sales growth ~6% (5% ex-Bombardier), sales $40.7B-$40.9B, EPS $10.6-$10.7; Q4 EPS $2.52-$2.62 with segment margin 22.5% to 22.8%.

segments.title: Aerospace Technologies
points: Organic sales grew 12% with strength in commercial aftermarket and defense and space; commercial OE returned to growth.
Segment margin declined 160 bps to 26.1% on cost inflation and acquisition headwinds, but improved sequentially.

segments.title: Industrial Automation
points: Organic sales grew 1% led by sensing and warehouse automation strength.
Segment margin declined 150 bps to 18.8% due to inflationary pressures.

segments.title: Building Automation
points: Organic sales increased 7% with broad-based strength across solutions and products.
Margin expanded 80 bps on volume leverage and productivity.

segments.title: Energy and Sustainability Solutions
points: Organic sales declined 2% as licensing and catalyst deliveries shifted, offsetting refrigerants strength.
Segment margin was flat at 24.5% with one-time items offsetting cost pressures.

notes.title: Solstice spin impact
points: Spin expected to reduce 2025 sales by $0.7B, adjusted EPS by ~$0.21, and free cash flow by $0.2B.
Like-for-like free cash flow expectations remain unchanged despite the spin.

notes.title: Orders and backlog
points: Orders grew 22% with broad-based strength and book-to-bill above 1.0.
Backlog reached a new record, supporting 2026 visibility.

themes.title: Industrial automation mix and orders
points: Management noted timing variability in warehouse automation and mix headwinds driving Q4 softness.
Orders were strong in Q3 but sustainability of short-cycle recovery remains unproven.

themes.title: Energy timing and margin pressure
points: Lower energy prices delayed project licensing and catalyst shipments into 2026.
Cost inflation and mix pressure drive a more cautious ESS margin outlook.

top_questions.question: Why does IA return to growth in Q3 but soften in Q4?
top_questions.summary: Management cited order timing in warehouse automation and a tougher prior-year comparison.

top_questions.question: Is aerospace OE recovery sustainable?
top_questions.summary: Management described OE revenue as recoupling to build rates with strong orders supporting H2 growth.

top_questions.question: How should investors model the Solstice spin impact?
top_questions.summary: The spin reduces 2025 sales by ~$0.7B and adjusted EPS by ~$0.21, with like-for-like FCF unchanged.

implications: Record orders and book-to-bill above 1.0 imply sustained long-cycle demand into 2026.
Solstice separation clarifies capital allocation and could improve margins in the remaining portfolio.
competitive_notes: Aerospace aftermarket and defense strength continues to outpace peers with slower OE recovery.
forecast_hooks: Track Q4 ESS licensing and catalyst shipment timing versus the lower guide.
Watch IA mix and margin trajectory as warehouse automation order timing normalizes.

action_items: Check channel signals on aerospace OE inventory drawdown and delivery cadence.
Validate ESS project timing and catalyst order pipelines for 2026.
open_questions: How quickly can pricing offsets close the inflation gap in aerospace margins?
Will IA short-cycle demand hold up as comps get tougher in Q4?
watch_next_quarter: Q4 organic sales delivery versus 8% to 10% guidance.
Solstice separation execution and any stranded cost disclosures.
